snippet: Prime Minister David Cameron and the opposition leader, Ed Miliband, combine emotional appeals with hardheaded warnings as the vote approaches.
abstract: British political leaders sweep through Scotland in an effort to head off increasingly real prospect that Britain could be dismembered if Scotland votes for independence; both Prime Min David Cameron and opposition leader Ed Miliband stress that a vote for independence would be 'irreversible'; visits draw mocking response from Alex Salmond, leader of the Scottish government and the pro-independence campaign.

byline.original: By STEPHEN CASTLE and ALAN COWELL
byline.contributor: Stephen Castle reported from Edinburgh, and Alan Cowell from London. Chad Bray contributed reporting from London.

lead_paragraph: Prime Minister David Cameron and the opposition leader, Ed Miliband, combine emotional appeals with hardheaded warnings as the vote approaches.

headline.main: Rival British Leaders Campaign in Unity Against Independence for Scotland
headline.print_headline: Rival British Leaders Campaign in Unity Against Independence for Scotland
